revised_title: Late-glacial and Post-glacial Vegetational Sequence in the Windermere Basin
tldr: The authors conducted a pollen analysis of lake sediments from the Windermere Basin to study the post-glacial history of British vegetation. They discovered a well-developed late-glacial succession and found that the Windermere profile carried the story back into the late-glacial period. The study helps to fit this region into the general picture of the Quaternary history of the British Isles and offers a possibility of applying a geochronological time-scale.
